results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);United States Politics and Government;Elections, House of Representatives;Campaign Finance;Content Type: Personal Profile;Ethics and Official Misconduct;internal-sub-only;Santos, George (1988- );House of Representatives;Baruch College;Citigroup Inc;Goldman Sachs Group Inc;Devolder Organization;Friends of Pets United;New York State;Long Island (NY)
results.byline: By Grace Ashford and Michael Gold
results.title: Who Is Rep.-Elect George Santos? His Résumé May Be Largely Fiction.
results.abstract: Mr. Santos, a Republican from New York, says he’s the “embodiment of the American dream.” But he seems to have misrepresented a number of his career highlights.

media.caption: George Santos, at the Republican Jewish Coalition in November, said he worked at Citigroup and Goldman Sachs, but neither firm had records of his employment.
media.copyright: Mikayla Whitmore for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Real Estate (Commercial);Real Estate and Housing (Residential);Urban Areas;Computers and the Internet;internal-sub-only;Labor and Jobs;Quarantine (Life and Culture);Telecommuting;Yelp;Mixt (MG Restaurants Inc);San Francisco (Calif);San Francisco Bay Area (Calif)
results.byline: By Conor Dougherty, Emma Goldberg and Aaron Wojack
results.title: What Comes Next for the Most Empty Downtown in America
results.abstract: Tech workers are still at home. The $17 salad place is expanding into the suburbs. So what is left in San Francisco?

media.caption: On any given week in San Francisco, office buildings are at about 40 percent of their prepandemic occupancy.

results.adx_keywords: Royal Families;Harry, Duke of Sussex;Markle, Meghan;Charles III, King of the United Kingdom;Great Britain;California
results.title: When Harry Met Meghan
results.abstract: Harry and Meghan seemed content to be part of the royal family if only the royal family had been willing to embrace change.
per_facet: Charles III, King of the United Kingdom

results.adx_keywords: Social Media;Polls and Public Opinion;Appointments and Executive Changes;Company Reports;Musk, Elon;Twitter;Tesla Motors Inc
results.title: Elon Musk Keeps Silent After Twitter Users Say He Should Quit as Boss
results.abstract: Mr. Musk had surveyed Twitter about whether he should remain in charge, and had said he would abide by the result.

media.caption: Elon Musk asked Twitter users if he should step down as head of the social media site.

results.adx_keywords: Abortion;Priests;Pavone, Frank;Priests for Life;Roman Catholic Church;Amarillo (Tex);Texas
results.byline: By Elizabeth Dias and Ruth Graham
results.title: Vatican Removes Anti-Abortion Activist From the Priesthood
results.abstract: Frank Pavone’s work has led to clashes over the years with some Catholic leaders.

media.caption: Frank Pavone leads the advocacy organization Priests for Life and was once a religious adviser to former President Donald J. Trump.
media.copyright: Zack Wittman for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Roberts, John G Jr;Kagan, Elena;Supreme Court (US)
results.title: An ‘Imperial Supreme Court’ Asserts Its Power, Alarming Scholars
results.abstract: Several new studies document the current court’s distinctive insistence on its dominance and the justices’ willingness to use procedural shortcuts to achieve it.

media.caption: One study found that the Supreme Court led since 2005 by Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. has been “uniquely willing to check executive authority.”

results.adx_keywords: Social Media;Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestitures;Polls and Public Opinion;Censorship;Musk, Elon;Twitter
results.byline: By Kate Conger and Ryan Mac
results.title: ‘The Last Straw’: Twitter Users Rage Over Elon Musk’s Latest Actions
results.abstract: Fury mounted over Mr. Musk’s moves to prevent Twitter users from sharing links to other social media platforms. The billionaire also asked whether he should remain as head of the service.

media.caption: Elon Musk, center, was photographed with Jared Kushner, left, at the World Cup final in Qatar on Sunday. Later that day, Mr. Musk asked his Twitter followers to decide whether he should remain as head of the social media service.

results.adx_keywords: Airlines and Airplanes;Aviation Accidents, Safety and Disasters;Hawaiian Airlines Incorporated;Hawaii
results.title: 36 People Hurt, 11 Seriously, as Turbulence Rocks a Flight to Hawaii
results.abstract: A 14-month-old and a teenager were among those injured in the flight from Phoenix to Honolulu, the authorities said.

media.caption: Some of those who injured when a Hawaiian Airlines flight experienced turbulence on Sunday were taken to The Queen’s Medical Center in Honolulu.

results.adx_keywords: Christmas;Weather;Cold and Cold Spells;Snow and Snowstorms;United States;Appalachian Region;East Coast (US);Northeastern States (US);Rocky Mountains
results.title: Winter Storm and Bitter Cold Could Disrupt Holiday Travel
results.abstract: A storm could make for treacherous conditions for parts of the country leading up to Christmas. Temperatures are also expected to plummet, forecasters said.

media.caption: Cities on the East Coast, including New York City, are unlikely to have a white Christmas, as the storm will probably pass on Thursday and Friday as a “rain event” before temperatures plummet.

results.adx_keywords: Television;News and News Media;Deaths (Obituaries);Peabody Awards;Veterans;Drew Griffin;CNN;Veterans Affairs Department;Atlanta (Ga)
results.title: Drew Griffin, CNN Investigative Journalist, Dies at 60
results.abstract: His reporting on delayed care for military veterans at Veterans Affairs hospitals led to the resignation of the secretary of the department.

media.caption: Drew Griffin in 2015. He led an investigative team that broke a story about at least 19 veterans who died after their appointments at Veterans Affairs hospitals had been delayed.

results.adx_keywords: Christmas;Christians and Christianity;Protestant Churches;United States
results.title: O Come All Ye Faithful, Except When Christmas Falls on a Sunday
results.abstract: Worried about coaxing people into pews when they’d rather be in their pajamas, some Protestant pastors are canceling Sunday services on Dec. 25.

media.caption: For some churches, following a Christmas Eve service with a Christmas morning service did not seem practical.
media.copyright: Joanna Kulesza for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Television;Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestitures;Video Recordings, Downloads and Streaming;Television Sets and Media Devices;Cable Television;Dolan, James L;AMC (TV Network)
results.title: Want to Understand Television’s Troubles? Look at AMC.
results.abstract: The company has struggled to earn enough from streaming to make up for losses from its traditional cable business. It is a story widespread in the industry.

media.caption: Sam Reid as Lestat de Lioncourt in the AMC Networks series “Interview With the Vampire.” The show is one of the most popular programs in the United States.

results.adx_keywords: Mass Shootings;Right-Wing Extremism and Alt-Right;Fringe Groups and Movements;Freedom of Speech and Expression;Computers and the Internet;QAnon;Conspiracy Theories;Nishimura, Hiroyuki (1976- );4chan;2channel;Japan;United States
results.byline: By Ben Dooley and Hisako Ueno
results.title: In the U.S., His Site Has Been Linked to Massacres. In Japan, He’s a Star.
results.abstract: Hiroyuki Nishimura has become a famous voice for disenchanted young Japanese. What he talks much less about is his ownership of the notorious website 4chan.

media.caption: Hiroyuki Nishimura, left, who started 2channel and now owns 4chan, with the writer Hirotada Ototake in Tokyo in June.
media.copyright: Ko Sasaki for The New York Times

results.title: Qatar Got the World Cup It Wanted
results.abstract: In the end, after a tournament shadowed by controversy since the host rights were awarded, Qatar had the turn in the global spotlight it sought.

media.caption: Lionel Messi received the Golden Ball as the World Cup’s best player from Qatar’s emir, Sheikh Tamim bin Hamad al-Thani.

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Trump Tax Returns;Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);Presidential Election of 2020;Trump, Donald J;Republican Party;House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack
results.title: Trump Faces a Week of Headaches on Jan. 6 and His Taxes
results.abstract: The House panel investigating the Capitol attack is set to release its report and may back criminal charges against the former president, while a separate committee could decide to release his tax returns.
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

media.caption: Donald J. Trump announced his third run for the presidency last month in Florida.

results.adx_keywords: United Nations Convention on Biological Diversity;Biodiversity;Land Use Policies;Endangered and Extinct Species;International Relations;Oceans and Seas;Indigenous People;Global Warming;Greenhouse Gas Emissions
results.title: Nearly Every Country Signs On to a Sweeping Deal to Protect Nature
results.abstract: Roughly 190 nations, aiming to halt a dangerous decline in biodiversity, agreed to preserve 30 percent of the planet’s land and seas. The United States is not officially a participant.
des_facet: United Nations Convention on Biological Diversity

media.caption: The agreement reached in Montreal comes as biodiversity is declining worldwide at rates never seen before in human history.

results.adx_keywords: Privacy;Children and Childhood;Children's Online Privacy Protection Act;Computer and Video Games;Federal Trade Commission
results.title: Epic Games to Pay $520 Million Over Children’s Privacy and Trickery Charges
results.abstract: The creator of Fortnite and other popular games violated children’s privacy and duped millions of users into unwanted purchases, federal regulators said.

media.caption: A teenage boy playing the video game Fortnite in England in 2018.

results.adx_keywords: Soccer;World Cup (Soccer);Witchcraft;Superstitions;vis-photo;Messi, Lionel;Argentina;Rosario (Argentina)
results.byline: By Jack Nicas and Ana Lankes
results.title: Behind Argentina’s World Cup Magic, an Army of Witches
results.abstract: France might have its star Kylian Mbappé, but Argentina has hundreds of “brujas” casting spells to protect Lionel Messi and the rest of its national squad.

media.caption: Magalí Martínez, a self-proclaimed witch, is one of hundreds who has used magic to try to help Argentina’s soccer team.
media.copyright: Anita Pouchard Serra for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Space and Astronomy;Homosexuality and Bisexuality;Discrimination;Physics;Rumors and Misinformation;Government Employees;Names, Organizational;Webb, James H Jr;Prescod-Weinstein, Chanda;Kirchick, James;Oluseyi, Hakeem;Eisenhower, Dwight David;Truman, Harry S;National Aeronautics and Space Administration
results.title: How Naming the James Webb Telescope Turned Into a Fight Over Homophobia
results.abstract: Did the former head of NASA discriminate against gay people? One physicist tried to rebut the accusation, only to find himself the target of attacks.

media.caption: James Webb, who ran NASA in the 1960s. The debate over the telescope cuts to the core of who is worthy to memorialize and how past human accomplishment should be balanced with modern standards of social justice.

results.byline: By Royston Jones Jr., David Yaffe-Bellany, Matthew Goldstein and Rob Copeland
results.title: Sam Bankman-Fried Said to Agree to Extradition After Chaotic Hearing
results.abstract: The disgraced FTX founder, who has been in a Bahamas prison for the past week, agreed to be sent to the United States, after a confusing day in court.
